Expectation1: Ensure client satisfaction and address any concerns or complaints professionally
Situation1: A first-time visitor looks disappointed with the colour tone in the mirror.
Expectation2: Provide clients with clear and accurate legal advice
Situation2: The client is facing an urgent legal issue and relies on precise advice for immediate action
Story:
I was halfway through rinsing the dye from my client’s hair when I noticed her frown in the mirror. She hesitated, then quietly said, “This isn’t quite the shade I expected.” My heart sank. As a hairdresser, I knew I had to address her disappointment, listen carefully, and find a way to make things right. I could see she was nervous, maybe even regretting her choice to come here. I wanted to reassure her, to fix it, to make her feel beautiful and heard.

Just then, my phone buzzed in my pocket. I glanced at the screen—an urgent message from a legal client. She was in trouble, needing immediate advice about a contract dispute that could cost her dearly. As her advocate, I was expected to respond quickly and accurately, to guide her through the next steps without delay.

I felt torn, standing there with dye-stained gloves, caught between two people who needed me in completely different ways. My mind raced, weighing the expectations pressing in from both sides, knowing that whatever I chose, someone would be left waiting.
